articles.title: Making of Ganitha Netra

articles.contents:
Project Time line

February First week- Working group is created


February Second Week- Logo design is completed


February Third Week- Logo is generated with \(\LaTeX\)


February Last Week- Event poster is created


February Last Week- Website is designed with distill


February 23 -Website is published in GitHub

articles.contents:
Ganitha Netra

            About the Maths Club
            Infinity is the title of Saintgits Mathematics Club,
            constituted in the month of November, 2011 under the
            guidance of Prof.¬†C.C. Kurian, Professor & Head,
            Department of Mathematics.
            Purpose of the Maths Club is to develop students‚Äô level
            of Math skills and knowledge. This will be accomplished by
            using games, activities, and mock competitions. Students
            will cooperatively work to complete Logic and Math
            Puzzles.
            Maths Club will support classroom learning, enrich their
            skills with higher order thinking, and prepare students for
            future Maths Competitions. We are able to invite speakers
            from a variety of mathematical areas in order to broaden the
            understanding of both the wide variety of topics and the
            potential applications of math. Understanding of these
            greatly benefits the students, as it opens their eyes to the
            variety of opportunities available through the study of
            math. It also serves to create a community of people
            interested in math, without the classification of a study
            group.
            
            
            Ganitha Netra
            Ganitha Netra is a math short video contest hosted by the
            Department of Mathematics in association with infinity. This
            event is conducted as part of the national level
            techno-cultural festival Nakshatra-2023.

articles.title: Event Details
articles.description: First National Level math short video contest
articles.contents:
Contents
Ganitha Netra
Details of the event
Prize money distribution
Rules & Regulations
Contacts


Ganitha Netra

First National Level math short video contest hosted by Department of Mathematics




Figure 1: Logo of Ganitha Netra event




Theme of the contest: Mathematics in Nature


Targeted participants: Students from Engineering Colleges in India (Valid College ID proof is required)


About the event: An event specially designed to visualize the world around us through the fascinating kaleidoscope of Mathematics. A team work with a mathematical mind and logic always produce wonderful products. The math vision is the skill of viewing the space around you through the magnifying lens of Mathematics. Do you believe that you have that math vision with in you? Then, \({\color{red}{\text{Ganita Netra}}}\)- The short math video contest that explore the nature through mathematics is a right place to showcase your math vision skill to the entire country. Let‚Äôs join the celebration of exploring patterns in the nature.

Details of the event

Time limits

    - Presentation time-5 minutes.
    - Narrations/ explanation- 2 minutes

Total prize money

    - Total prize money is 6K
    
Prize money distribution
    - First prize-  3K
    - Second prize- 2K
    - Third price-  1K
    
Rules & Regulations
Maximum duration of the video shall be 5 minutes
Submit video links (through the Google form shared) after uploading the video in personal drive.
Only self made videos are allowed. Downloaded/ edited videos from external sources are not accepted in the competition.
Theme of the video shall be ‚ÄúMathematics in Nature‚Äù.
Background music and inline narration are also allowed.
Maximum time allotted to a team is 7 minutes including initial preparations.
Decisions of the judges shall be final.
Minimum participation to claim a prize is 3.
Contacts

For more details, contact:

Nehna Lezya Sarin M, üì± 7736638441
Neeraja Anil, üì± 7736266317
Bijo Babu Cherian, üì± 8075210440
